content.description: Start at the base of the dihedral with a perched pillar of rock 15 feet off the ground. Climb past the perched pillar on easy rock, traverse left on the major ramp (crossing Running on Borrowed Power) and carefully continue up the headwall above.
Speed as fast as you want on the Autobahn, clipping silver as you climb just left of the major left-facing dihedral.
content.protection: A lot of QDs to open shuts

content.description: Some difficult moves above the small grotto get one onto the east face of the Maroon Tower.  From here the line stays on the face just left of the left edge deviating to the better holds.
content.location: The first (left most)route on the east face of Maroon Tower

content.description:
The crux is coming out of the 12

feet face roof and over its edge.
content.protection: a dozen draws will get you thru.  2 are fixed.
content.location: Find this climb on the west side of the Maroon Tower in the perched cove area where the Maroon Tower meets the wall above the right most of the grottoes.  Or simply climb the longest roof here.

content.description: Start on the bouldery steep face 15 feet right of the Maroon Tower base. On the major ramp traverse right (crossing Stage Fright) and carefully continue up the steep laybacks on the headwall above.

Most of the route that lies on the white rock is over hanging.  From a corner face climb to right to  a perch about 10 feet below a roof. Proceed up to and through the roof and up the last of the face.
content.location: About 70 feet left of where the white rock and red base meet the limestone rock.

content.description: Climb the right set of bolts on the steep red face.  At the roof begin at the narrowest passage using the high bolt on the right on the face above.  Traverse right soon standing up on that ledge and then proceed up the overhanging face to the anchors.
content.location: This route is 5th from the leftmost roof route on the west side of the Maroon Tower and the belay begins on the east side of the Perched Cove.

content.description: A face climb the begins stemming about a crack and then head left and near the top heads right to bolts.
content.location: About 5 feet to the left of the Perched Cove High Point began.

content.description: This overhanging route begins as a face climb and ends with some crack moves if done the securest way.
content.protection: 9 quick draws and maybe 2 are fixed
content.location: This route is currently the 2nd route from the leftmost of the routes on the right most and overhanging whitish wall of the Maroon Towers Wall.

content.description: The crux will hit you soon and it is likely that you will take flight.
content.location: climbs out the bulge and through the short roof above.

content.description: Ecoblast starts in the small alcove adjacent to the long boulder resting 10 feet from the cliff. After climbing up the ramp, continue up the projecting fins, ease through the gray-stained alcove (don't forget to use the no-hands rest), and step left onto the finishing headwall.
content.protection: About 14 QDs and open shuts. Some can easily be back cleaned.

content.description: The sustained 68 deg from horizontal wall has a major roof about 1/2 way up which is the eliminator zone.
content.location: About 100' east of the most overhanging prow known as the Maroon Tower.

content.description: Climb the steep red face on the right set of bolts and proceed thru the narrowest location in the horizontal roof clipping a bolt to the right and then traverse left to access to the easier face.
content.location: the route is the 4th line from the leftmost route on the west face of the Maroon Tower and begins on the right side of the Perched Cove.

content.description: A hard start and then move up the overhanging gully using more face climbing than stemming.
content.location: Just left of the base high point within the Perched Cove

content.description: File your flight plan with air traffic control by starting 10 feet right of the Maroon Tower base. Gain altitude to reach the major ramp and Barrel Roll left up the major dihedral. Launch left out onto the Maroon Tower and try not to pull a Split S.
Climb the red steep face and proceed more at straight up and then left onto the last big clam shell hold and then over the edge to easier face.
content.location: Route is 3rd right of the leftmost roof routes on the west face of the Maroon Tower and is situated on the right side of the Perched Cove.

content.description: Traverse up to the base of the chimney from the right.  Ascend the sport chimney utilizing crack and face climbing skills. Move right along the huge undercling and follow the arete to the anchor.
content.location: Starts 5 feet right of the tree at the right side of the Maroon Towers Wall.

content.description: Climb up the lower left prow of the major ramp and continue into the white, open dihedral on the headwall above. Brawl (or finesse) your way out the top of the dihedral and up the right side of the headwall roof.
Some steep face leads to a left angling horizontal climb and then onto easy face.
content.location: This route is second one right from the leftmost one on the west face/overhang of the Maroon Tower

pathTokens: Area 5:  Red and White Grotto Walls
